question_text: A particle travels 1.2 m in 0.60 s and has a momentum of 4.0 × 10⁻² kg·m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
Which of the following best describes the direction of force on a negative charge moving in a magnetic field?
option_a: Zero, because magnetic fields do not act on negative charges
option_b: Perpendicular to the velocity and field
option_c: In the direction of the field
explanation: The magnetic force on a charge is perpendicular to both the velocity and magnetic field direction (F = qvB sinθ).

question_text: The work function of a metal is 2.0 eV. Light of frequency 1.0 × 10¹⁵ Hz is incident on it. What is the maximum kinetic energy of the emitted electrons? (Use h = 6.63 × 10⁻³⁴ J·s, 1 eV = 1.60 × 10⁻¹⁹ J)

subtopic: Wave Properties (v = fλ, types of waves)
question_text: Which wave property differs between red and violet light when both travel in a vacuum?
explanation: All light waves travel at the same speed in a vacuum, but red and violet light differ in frequency and wavelength. Frequency is the identifying factor here.

subtopic: Wave Properties (v = fλ, types of waves)
question_text: A wave travels at 3.0 × 10⁸ m/s and has a frequency of 6.0 × 10¹⁴ Hz. What is its wavelength?
